page.title: 08Transport in Cattistock
page.content: Rail service nearby; nearest station one and a half miles away at Maiden Newton. No station staff except signal man. Single track to Dorchester and Weymouth (south), Yeovil, Bristol and connections to South Wales (north). Railway connects with ferries in Weymouth to the Channel Islands. Many holidaymakers in summer, and freight to the Islands. Cattistock Halt closed 20 years ago and branch line to Bridport and West Bay (a small seaside resort) closed ten years ago. One villager flies his own light aircraft and farmers travel short distances by tractor. Few cyclists except young children and a limited number of horse riders.
